description.narrative: 4.3 Social sector ministries and sub-national governments have the capacity to develop and implement child-responsive budgets, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents in Sri Lanka, including the most deprived, have their human rights protected and benefit from effective child-sensitive social protection system.

sector.narrative: PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: Lack of a national budget for 2020, a dissolved Parliament and the COVID-19 crisis had a significant impact on implementation in this area. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:25/08/2020

target.value: 2022:1.6 per cent of GDP maintained or increased

actual.value: 2020:No approved National Budget for 2020. Will report at year end.
